title: Kahn-e Karim
data: Kahn-e Karim (Persian: کهن کریم) is a village in, and the capital of, Paskuh Rural District of Paskuh District, Sib and Suran County, Sistan and Baluchestan province, Iran.[3] The previous capital of the rural district was the village of Paskuh.[4] At the time of the 2006 National Census, the village's population was 1,392 in 281 households, when it was in the former Sib and Suran District of Saravan County.[5] The following census in 2011 counted 931 people in 217 households,[6] by which time the district had been separated from the county in the establishment of Sib and Suran County. The rural district was transferred to the new Central District.[7] The 2016 census measured the population of the village as 287 people in 77 households.[2] After the census, the rural district was separated from the district in the formation of Paskuh District.[3] Iran portal This Sistan and Baluchestan province location article is a stub.
